query: URLs on your feel based on the friend list. Friend list are those members of users who follow your profile
key_findings: Ensure URLs are SEO-friendly by using descriptive keywords and avoiding unnecessary parameters. This improves discoverability and user experience.
Utilize canonical tags to prevent duplicate content issues when multiple URLs lead to the same content. This helps consolidate link equity.
Implement proper HTTP status codes (e.g., 301 for permanent redirects, 404 for not found) to guide search engines and users effectively.
Use semantic HTML5 elements, such as <a> for links, to enhance accessibility and improve the structure of your URLs.
Regularly audit your URLs for broken links and redirect chains to maintain site performance and user satisfaction.
Consider user privacy and data protection when displaying friend lists or follower information in URLs. Use anonymization techniques if necessary.
Adopt a consistent URL structure across your application to improve usability and make it easier for users to navigate.
Integrate social sharing features that allow users to easily share URLs with their friends, enhancing engagement and visibility.
Monitor URL performance using analytics tools to identify high-traffic pages and optimize them for better user retention.
Ensure that your API endpoints for retrieving friend lists and associated URLs are secured with proper authentication mechanisms to protect user data.

code_examples.description: Flask example for generating dynamic URLs based on user data
Express.js example for generating dynamic URLs

best_practices: Use hyphens to separate words in URLs for better readability and SEO.
Keep URLs short and relevant to the content they represent.
Avoid using special characters and excessive parameters in URLs.
Ensure that all dynamic URLs are properly encoded to handle special characters.
Implement 301 redirects for any URL changes to maintain SEO equity.
implementation_patterns: RESTful URL patterns: Use nouns to represent resources (e.g., /users/{id}) and actions as HTTP methods.
Hierarchical URLs: Structure URLs to reflect the hierarchy of the content (e.g., /users/{id}/friends).
SEO-friendly slugs: Generate slugs from user data (e.g., /users/john-doe) for better indexing.

integration_requirements.authentication: OAuth 2.0 for user data access, API keys for third-party integrations.

performance_considerations: Cache frequently accessed URLs to reduce server load and improve response times.
Use a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to serve static content and improve load times.
Optimize server response times by minimizing database queries and using efficient data retrieval methods.
security_considerations: Sanitize user input to prevent injection attacks when generating dynamic URLs.
Implement HTTPS to secure data in transit and protect user privacy.
Use rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage.
